com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.physics

Class Physics2d

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.Component
      • com.isoterik.mgdx.m2d.components.physics.Physics2d

  • public class Physics2d
extends Component
    GameObjects that need to simulate physics in 2D space should attach this component. This component is a wrapper for a box2D Body instance. It relies on one or more Colliders to generate collision shapes for the host game object. Note: this component uses the host game object as the user data for the Body for internal uses. Do not override the user data!

    • Field Detail

      • DynamicBody

        public static final com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.BodyDef.BodyType DynamicBody
        A dynamic body type. Dynamic bodies have positive mass, non-zero velocity determined by forces and moved by solver

      • StaticBody

        public static final com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.BodyDef.BodyType StaticBody
        A static body type. Static bodies have zero mass, zero velocity and may be manually moved

      • KinematicBody

        public static final com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.BodyDef.BodyType KinematicBody
        A kinematic body type. Kinematic bodies have zero mass and non-zero velocity set by user

        Parameters:
        bodyType - the body type

    • Method Detail

      • getBody

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body getBody()
        Gets the box2D Body that this instance uses.
        Returns:
        the box2D Body that this instance uses or null if the body is not created yet

      • getBody

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body getBody(Scene hostScene)
        This creates the physics body if it is not created yet and returns it. Note: null will be returned if this component is not attached to a game object yet. If there is an existing body, that body will be returned
        Parameters:
        hostScene - a scene where the host game object will be added to
        Returns:
        the created physics body or null if a body cannot be created

      • __interpolate

        public void __interpolate(float alpha)
        Interpolates the physic body to avoid temporal aliasing. This method is called internally by the system and should never be called directly.
        Parameters:
        alpha - the ratio of the time spent by the renderer to a fixed time steps

      • __setHostScene

        public void __setHostScene(Scene scene)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Sets the host Scene. This method is called internally by the system and should never be called directly!
        Overrides:
        __setHostScene in class Component
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene where the host game object resides

      • attach

        public void attach()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the component is attached to a GameObject. Note: At this point it is guaranteed that a game object exists for this component but it is not guaranteed that the game object has been added to a Scene yet!
        Overrides:
        attach in class Component

      • detach

        public void detach()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the component is getting detached from the host game object. The GameObject instance will become null after this method completes so this is the last place to communicate with the game object. It is usually a good idea to dispose component-allocated resources here. Resources disposed here are usually the ones allocated in Component.attach()
        Overrides:
        detach in class Component

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the host game object is added to a Scene. If the game object is already added to a scene before this component gets attached, this method will still be called (immediately after Component.attach()) It is safe to make scene related calls here because a Scene instance exists. This is where you will typically do all initializations.
        Overrides:
        start in class Component

      • componentAdded

        public void componentAdded(Component component)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when a new component is attached to the host game object. Note: the new component will be added once this method completes and every other component is notified.
        Overrides:
        componentAdded in class Component
        Parameters:
        component - the new component

      • componentRemoved

        public void componentRemoved(Component component)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when an existing component is getting detached from the host game object. Note: the new component will be detached once this method completes and every other component is notified.
        Overrides:
        componentRemoved in class Component
        Parameters:
        component - the new component

      • fixedUpdate

        public void fixedUpdate(float deltaTime)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Called when the physics engine is updated. This is where you'll typically put physics related codes.
        Overrides:
        fixedUpdate in class Component
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time difference between the current frame and the previous frame.
